result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Heidi A Hecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today (9/16/216).
If Probation feels appropriate, may petition for early discharge after 1  year.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost for each count (2 & 3), for a total of $531.20, to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond from 15CF262 to be applied with remaining balance to be refunded to poster.
$200.00 DNA surcharge for each count (2 & 3), for a total of $400.00, to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond from 15CF262 to be applied with remaining balance to be refunded to poster.
Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.
Must provide DNA sample for each count (2 & 3).
Must complete an AODA assessment & comply with recommendations.
